DOC.brief_title: Group Prenatal Care Reducing Risk STDs Pregnant Young Women
DOC.detailed_description: Millions young adult become infected sexually transmit disease ( STDs ) year . Young adult particularly vulnerable STD infection educate STDs use condom improperly inconsistently . Transmission STDs pregnant woman baby occur , , birth . It , therefore , particularly important educate young pregnant woman STDs . Group prenatal care may beneficial way assist young woman . It would allow increase contact care provider , integrate complex need pregnant woman , provide support service . This study determine effectiveness two group prenatal care program compare individual prenatal care reduce risk HIV STDs young woman pregnancy . Participants unblinded study randomly assign one three group : standard individual prenatal care ; standard CenteringPregnancy group prenatal care ; CenteringPregnancy Plus ( CP+ ) group prenatal care . All participant assign either CenteringPregnancy CP+ initial individual medical exam . Groups form base participant ' estimate delivery month , lead trained independent practitioner . There ten 2-hour group session Weeks 16 40 pregnancy . At session , participant first weigh take blood pressure chart progress . Individual prenatal assessment last approximately 30 minute conduct practitioner . Participants time fill handouts self-assessments engage discussion group member . Discussions focus education building prenatal , childbirth , parent skill . The CP+ session include HIV/STD risk reduction component addition element standard CenteringPregnancy program . This additional feature consist interactive discussion , exercise , skill-building activity target towards reduce HIV/STD risk behavior . Participants assign receive standard individual prenatal care participate group session , receive standard prenatal care . Outcome measure include incidence STD infection , rapid repeat pregnancy , degree sexual risk behavior , perinatal psychosocial factor .
DOC.criteria: Pregnant currently less 24 week gestation English Spanishspeaking Willing randomly assign either group individual prenatal care Any severe medical problem require individualized assessment track `` highrisk pregnancy '' ( e.g. , active substance use , mental illness , HIV )
